revised_title: Effects of Arousal Levels on Cortical Neurone Activity in Sleep and Wakefulness
tldr: The study investigates the effects of changing arousal levels on the spontaneous activity of cortical neurones during sleep and wakefulness. The research shows that the modal interval and geometric standard deviation of interval distributions vary systematically with the state of arousal in cats. These findings provide a comparative measure of an animal's state of alertness and can help in understanding the differences in neuronal activity during sleep and wakefulness.
